Structural Smell Detector

class code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.StructuralSmellDetector(thresholds)[source]

Bases: object

A class to detect structural code smells in Python projects.

This class analyzes Python source code files within a directory to identify various structural code smells based on predefined thresholds.

structural_smells

A list to store detected structural smells.

Type:

list

class_info

A dictionary to store information about classes.

Type:

defaultdict

module_info

A dictionary to store information about modules.

Type:

defaultdict

dependency_graph

A directed graph to represent module dependencies.

Type:

nx.DiGraph

thresholds

A dictionary of threshold values for various smell detections.

Type:

dict

project_root

The root directory of the project being analyzed.

Type:

str

analyze_directory(directory_path)[source]

Analyze all Python files in the given directory and its subdirectories.

Parameters:

directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to be analyzed.

analyze_file(file_path)[source]

Analyze a single Python file for structural information.

This method parses the file and extracts information about classes, methods, attributes, and module dependencies.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The path to the Python file to be analyzed.

detect_cbo()[source]
detect_dit()[source]

Detect modules with a Deep Inheritance Tree (DIT).

This method identifies modules with a high number of classes, which may indicate a deep inheritance tree.

detect_lcom()[source]

Detect classes with high Lack of Cohesion of Methods (LCOM).

This method calculates a simplified LCOM metric for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_loc()[source]
detect_mpc()[source]
detect_noc()[source]
detect_nocc()[source]

Detect modules with a high Number of Classes (NOCC).

This method counts the number of classes in each module and identifies those exceeding the NOCC threshold.

detect_nom()[source]

Detect classes with a high Number of Methods (NOM).

This method identifies classes that exceed the NOM threshold and adds them to the structural smells list.

detect_rfc()[source]

Detect classes with high Response for a Class (RFC).

This method calculates a simplified RFC metric for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_size2()[source]

Detect large classes based on the SIZE2 metric.

This method calculates the SIZE2 metric (sum of methods and attributes) for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

detect_smells(directory_path)[source]

Detect structural smells in the given directory.

This method analyzes all Python files in the given directory and its subdirectories, and runs various smell detection methods.

Parameters:

directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to be analyzed.

detect_wac()[source]

Detect classes with high Weight of a Class (WAC).

This method counts the number of attributes in each class and identifies those exceeding the WAC threshold.

detect_wmpc()[source]

Detect classes with high Weighted Methods per Class (WMPC).

This method calculates a simplified WMPC for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold.

print_report()[source]
code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.analyze_structure(directory_path, thresholds)[source]
